name: Inferno 3.10.1
body:
## Core
- Fixes issue in Internet explorer where synthetic events propagate through disabled element

name: Inferno 3.10.0
body:
This is maintenance release, since it will take for a while before next major version is ready. This release includes bunch of commits from development branch.

## Core
- All internal dependencies are updated  https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/commit/2c11f6399bb5d1fa1a0ca9ed54feb8f9d05ee123
- es6 builds: `index.es.js` are now built using production mode https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/commit/b2b7a25edd4ba2d6417da743bff096d3532f25fe
- Guard against external changes on text nodes https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/1207
- Port: process element flow to if - else structure  https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/commit/0628b080cc11daa1b802596d4c7465e96e78e83f

## Inferno Component
- Removes parentVNode recursion in favor of simple while loop https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/commit/6bb02e84bdebfb01faf04ff3eddef218427e5d40
- Guards againts setState callback being invalid object https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/commit/5ff862fd3a4d32f5e3be6f6adff410a56190345d

## Inferno Test utils
- Removed createElement dependency https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/commit/2c11f6399bb5d1fa1a0ca9ed54feb8f9d05ee123 

## Inferno Redux
- Removed createElement dependency https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/commit/20c74e469cb22ae35fb4472a08ba9c1d27deab02


## Inferno Server
- Fix passing context to render method https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/commit/4e31950b0c18f9b03fd81978b08a71aed7b7da19

name: Inferno 3.9.0
body:
## Inferno core
- Fixes crash where parent component removed child component during child's lifecycle event after returning null in `Component's` render
- Small optimizations to keyed/non-keyed algorithms https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/commit/b93bcb273bd4cd7b3e5db5a03b0aeebad263063c
- Changed to object literal in vNode creation for more reliable performance https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/commit/62a544db7a0ffc48faa384b72751783160d6d83c

## Inferno-server
- Optimized fast path in `escapeText` function https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/commit/5a035c939a58034227b2f117bc7f5625f755d434

## Inferno-component
- Changed setState type to allow partial updates https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/commit/d14fa5d76d38707f7a23d102c8306f1494c15dd4

name: Inferno 3.8.2
body:
## All packages
Fixed bad build caused by rollup bug.

name: Inferno 3.8.1
body:
### Inferno-server
This release fixes XSS vulnerability in `inferno-server` package when double quotes were used as text content. https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/1191

name: Inferno 3.8.0
body:
## Component
- Fixes bug where child context was created too early https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/1182
- Removed deprecated method `setStateSync` setState will replace it without any breaking changes
- Fixes setState type https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/pull/1189

## Router - new feature: Async data fetching
See `inferno-router` package README.md for full details   https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/commit/bd33957b9e9368d802baba2fcd02d847d00f0192 (https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/tree/master/packages/inferno-router#async-data-fetching)

## Core
Fixes issue where HTML content was replaced with identical content using `dangerouslySetInnerHtml` https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/commit/b8c14f71f06a90eddb144c1e3f063844c317661d

name: Inferno 3.7.1
body: This release adds support for indeterminate check box state and minor performance optimizations.

name: Inferno 3.7.0
body:
### Inferno-core
- Fixes performance issue in `patchKeyedChildren` algorithm where DOM was manipulated more than needed #1169
- Functional component class methods now gets props passed into lifecycle hooks #https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/commit/654bcf5298b264817492dfca2cd3def216554445


### Inferno-server 
- Pass props / state / context to render method same way as its used on client side. #https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/commit/0ddd05938d2b2fd1bcaf05b1ba14bb509adceb9a
- Fixes bug where `value` property was not correctly rendered for select - option elements

### Test-utils
- `renderToSnapshot` now correctly adds className https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/commit/4c4b8946ca1056f4f747944fea18283f0bacc562

All files in the project were ran through prettier and packages updated plus other minor internal workflow changes

name: Inferno 3.6.4
body:
Fixes bad build in `inferno-redux` package. https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/1157

Build script was also modified to stop in case of errors to avoid regression in future.

name: Inferno 3.6.3
body:
This release fixes two bugs in `inferno-hydration` -package:

1 - Patching empty elements (https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/1137)
2 - It now correctly sets `dom` for ES6 classes in hydration

name: Inferno 3.6.0
body:
### Inferno-Server
Overall SSR performance improved (https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/commit/bdb6ea15f75ef7b323180a139e618aaa6240effb) by using following techiques:
- escapeText converted from regexp to pure javascript ( inspired by @localvoid's work! Credits for him. https://medium.com/@localvoid/improving-ssr-performance-in-virtual-dom-libraries-57232e2ead21)
- Caching layer added for CSS property names
- Logic routines separated for numbers and strings

name: Inferno 3.5.4
body:
### Core
Fixes performance regression when patching styles
Fixes bug where className properties were added to DOM when `cloneVNode` / `cloneElement` was used. https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/1144

### Component
Fixes bug where `forceUpdate` caused `shouldComponentUpdate` to be called. https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/1149

### Devtools
Performance optimizations for component updater https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/pull/1152

### Typescript
Fixes typings file name https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/pull/1147

name: Inferno 3.5.2
body:
This release fixes google chrome debugger getting stuck to null sourcemap. 

### Followings bugs were also fixed:

- RenderToSnapshot - incorrect reference to vNode.props https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/1135
- cloneVNode should prefer props over node to be cloned https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/1141

name: Inferno Redux Update
body:
- Update Inferno-Redux to the have the same API as the latest version of React-Redux bindings. Thanks to @Alxandr for all the hard work on this!
- Inferno now ships single file bundles for all module types (commonjs, ES6, UMD:develoment, UMD:production)

Internal Updates:
- New Internal Build System which should speed up builds.
- Fixture Testing (#970)
- Code is now styled with Prettier (#949)
- Testing overhaul to use Jest as the default unit test framework.

name: Inferno 3.4.4
body:
### Hydration
Fixes crash in hydration when server side rendered content and client side rendered content did not match. https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/1132

name: Inferno 3.4.3
body: Fixes version mismatch in version string.
RC

name: Inferno 3.4.2
body:
- Adds support for SVG foreignObject #1087
- Hydration now correctly cleans nodes that mismatch with SSR content #1101
- componentWillUnmount no longer blocks setState #1107
- defaultValue behaves now more like in React #1109
- Inferno-test-utils now handle null properly #1114

All internal dependencies have been updated

name: Inferno 3.3.1
body: Fixes bad merge caused in 3.3.0 release. https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/1100

name: Inferno 3.3.0
body:
## Inferno-component
Fixes bug where state was updated before componentWillUpdate callback (#1093)

## Inferno-devtools
Fixes bug where props weren't updated by React Devtools (#1095)

### Internal
New test runner task has been added `npm run tdd`, which watches for typescript file changes

name: Inferno 3.2.2
body:
## Inferno-core
This release fixes issue where `linkEvent` created event handlers even when event was not function.

name: Inferno 3.2.1
body:
### Inferno Core

This release fixes issue where form elements did not get their callbacks updated https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/1086

Also fixes issue where Inferno was trying to remove attributes even when there was nothing to remove.

name: Inferno 3.2.0
body:
## Inferno-core
Fixes bug where `HTML node` was removed from the DOM before `componentWillUnmount` callback was called.

## Inferno-mobx
Prefer user set SCU callbacks over default one.

## Inferno-Hyperscript
Fixes bug where "className" or "class" named props did not pass through components.

### Internal
All dependencies are updated to latest versions.

name: Inferno 3.1.2
body:
### Bug fixes

This release fixes bug where controlled inputs don't update their callbacks when `options.recyclingEnabled` is true.

name: Inferno 3.1.1
body:
### Inferno-router
path-to-regexp is now added to package.json dependencies to avoid NPM fetching old version

### Inferno-redux
Props are now merged in correct order

### Inferno-compat
PropTypes are now moved into seperate module

name: Inferno 3.1.0
body:
### Minor breaking change:
Selected option renders as boolean property to DOM nodes. for example:
```jsx
<select>
    <option>1</option>
    <option selected={true}>2</option>
</select>
```
This will make second option selected. When selected property is omitted and select is controlled it works as before (using value to select matching option).

### Test-utils
Jest snapshot serializer functions added (#1035)

### Inferno-mobx
`ShouldComponentUpdate` now properly returns false

name: Inferno 3.0.6
body:
This release fixes following bugs:
- devtools: fix crash when child is empty string (#1037)
- Router link without context (#1043)
- SSR: input rendering (#1048)

name: Inferno 3.0.5
body:
Fixes inferno-mobx connect function second parameter type (TS)
Minor performance boost to `inferno-mobx` integration by switching `createElement` to `createVNode` for component wrappers
Ensure component callback context is component when having multiple callbacks in queue

name: Inferno 3.0.4
body: Fixes bug where event listeners does not get removed. https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/1028

name: Inferno 3.0.3
body: Fixes import `isUnitlessNumber` so it can be used in Server side. https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/997

name: Inferno 3.0.2
body: Added internal functions to Inferno default export, this resolves issues with Webpack imports.

name: Inferno 3.0.1
body: Lock all inferno packages with exact version. Bump version string to 3.0.1

name: Inferno 3.0.0
body:
## Versioning
Inferno versioning changes to follow semantic versioning system. This means any kind of breaking change will ship with major version increase. http://semver.org/
`babel-plugin-inferno` https://github.com/infernojs/babel-plugin-inferno  will now be in same major version range with Inferno packages.

## Core
Minor performance improvements
Synthetic events now have `currentTarget` property in event parameter again :)

## Typescript
Inferno now compiles with `strictNullChecks` on
Added more type information to public APIs

## ES6 Component
Minor performance improvements
componentDidUpdate now sends lastState correctly


## Router
Allows to use Route without component prop #998 
Fixes percentage encoded url values #1002 

### Multiple bug fixes:
https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Fixed+3.0.0%22+is%3Aclosed

name: Inferno 1.6.2
body: Fixes issue with range type of input where defaultValue was not applied correctly. https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/999 Extra properties are now set before setting value for inputs.

name: Inferno 1.6.1
body: Fixes bug where ref callback was not called.

name: Inferno 1.6.0
body:
## Core
- Public functions in inferno core now have jsDoc annotations so they can be properly compressed by Google closure compiler. It also provides type information for non typescript environments

## ES6 Component
- `setState` will now switch to async as per React. `setStateSync` has been deprecated and will be removed in future release. They are identical now.
- setState callbacks now have caller component context and they don't need to be bound.
- calling `setState` from Component constructor will now fail to validation error.

### Reminer: JSX users make sure you have babel-plugin-inferno v3+ or you will get undefined props.

name: Inferno 1.5.6
body:
Simplified controlled elements logic. Fixes issue where onClick was triggered twice for radio buttons. https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/983

Minor internal code clean up.

name: Inferno 1.5.5
body: Fixes timing of setState callbacks when used inside componentWillReceiveProps or componentWillMount

name: Inferno 1.5.4
body: Fixes issue with event delegation in synthetic events. #974

name: Inferno 1.5
body:
# Inferno v1.5 Release Notes

### New Features
Potentially breaking change: 
`className` has been moved into vNode core, so  `createVNode` API has changed

## THIS VERSION REQUIRES BABEL-PLUGIN-INFERNO VERSION 3.0+

`setState` has been refactored and now correctly switches to async - What this means is that you no longer should have to manually set async, and fixes bugs around the cursor position on controlled text inputs

Performance enhancements

### Bug Fixes

 - [Github Issue #968](https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/968) - Fix for Inferno-compat Proptypes
 - [Github Issue #965](https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/965) - Fix for Inferno-compat packaging
 - [Github Issue #927](https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/927) - Fix for IE11 Invalid Argument 
 - [Github Issue #898](https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/898) - Fix for IE-Edge polyfills for Inferno-compat
 - [Github Issue #895](https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/895) - Fix for `setState`  parent / child component ordering bugs
 - [Github Issue #874](https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/874) - Drop current target from synthetic events
 - [Github Issue #864](https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/864) - Fix inferno-compat bug with radio buttons onChange event
 - [Github Issue #819](https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/819) - Fix for className being set with sibling className
 - [Github Issue #808](https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/808) - Fix for normalization process issues in  `createVNode`
 - [Github Issue #799](https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/799) - Fix for `hasSpreadAttributes` being incorrectly normalized
 - [Github Issue #738](https://github.com/infernojs/inferno/issues/738) - Fix for Controlled input, cursor jumps to the end

name: Inferno 1.4.0
body:
- Component LifeCycle methods are not defined by default.
- Fixes typo in namespaces constants xlink:title
- Fixes Issue where SVG attributes were not added correctly (inferno-compat)
- Fixes currentComponent being undefined (SSR)
- Added extra parenthesis for minified bundles (browser heuristics - optimize-js)
- Fixes async rendering performance regression

name: Inferno 1.3.0
body:
# Summary
Inferno repository is now using Lerna mono repo structure, all sources can be found under `package/name/src`.
Inferno-test-utils were fully rewritten from scratch. It provides new functions that can help testing Inferno applications. More about inferno-test-utils can be found from here: https://infernojs.org/docs/api/inferno-test-utils

## Core
- inferno-vnode-flags no longer has dependencies
- defaultProps are now handled before component is constructed
- removed already unmounted logic
- cloneVNode performance increased
- Inferno no longer de-hyphenates properties. Core uses properties like they are in DOM standard. fe: `<svg><use xlink:href="#test"></use></svg>`  React like behavior has been moved into inferno-compat package.
- Fixes defaultValue for non controlled `select` element
- Object.assign is removed from inferno sources. IE 11 now has native support.
- bug fix: allow textArea to use defaultValue
- bug fix: update props and state even when SCU returns false
- bug fix: better defaultChecked logic for checkboxes
- bug fix: Fixes issue where setStateSync changes was being discarded
- bug fix: renderToStream has better handling in invalid render scenario

### Normalization
- Fixes the issue of children being mutated causing instance being null exception
- Fixes bug where textNodes were not patched correctly
- Recursive performance has been increased

## Inferno-compat
- Inferno-server has better compatibility with Inferno-compat
- Inferno-compat now supports Immutable children

## Inferno-create-class
- Mixins now get their class instance passed correctly

## Router
- Added basic support for IndexRoute
- Links now have baseName support
- Fixes issue with redirects

## Hyperscript
- hyperscript no longer lower case tag names as some of them are case sensitive

name: Inferno 1.2.2
body:
- Fixes missing query parameters when URL is changed (router)
- Increases create-element performance up to 50% (create-element package)
- Fixes parameters for state function setter (setState) its now (state, props, context)
- Fixes infinite loop in testUtils

Internal:
- Benchmarks now use Inferno.version instead of hardcoded one
- Changed TsLint and ESlint to lint recursively whole project

name: Inferno 1.2.1
body:
This release contains minor bug fixes and four new functions into `inferno-server` package:
-  RenderStream,
-  RenderQueueStream,
-  streamQueueAsString,
-  streamQueueAsStaticMarkup

bug fixes:
- Fixes crash when rendering empty select tag
- Removes relative path to inferno (inferno-component)
- Adds onDoubleClick to onDblClick mapping (inferno-compat)
- Fixes Do not render children prop in SSR (inferno-compat, SSR)

babel-plugin-inferno (1.6.0) supports ES5 environment

name: Inferno 1.2.0
body:
- Passes down context (inferno-create-class) 
- Allows using value as prop when Element is not controlled (core)
- Fixes hydration appending issue (core)
- Move to rc-css-transition-group-modern dependency (inferno-compat)
- Fixes issue with string refs (rc-css-transition-group-modern dependency)
- Fixes issue with deprecated findNode (rc-css-transition-group-modern dependency)
- Allows numeric values to be used with devTools (inferno-devtools)
- Adds validation for server/client markup mismatch (core)
- Throws validation error if Inferno is initializing too early (core)
- Allows meta/control clicks for Link (inferno-router)
- Includes propTypes in infenro-compat build (inferno-compat)
- Fixes redirect bug when nextTick is not properly shimmed (inferno-router)
- Deleted deprecated inferno-dom package

name: Inferno 1.1.2
body:
- Exposes Inferno version in `Inferno.version` (core)
- Allows third parameter to be used as children (inferno-hyperscript)
- Fixes exception in phantomJS strict mode  (core)
- Adds 'hidden' to booleanProps (core)
- `unstable_renderIntoSubtree` now uses component function call context (inferno-compat)
- Calls componentWillMount only if it is function (inferno-test-utils)

name: Inferno 1.1.1
body:
- Better support for Typescript
- Fix error message for enableFindDOMNode
- inferno-hyperscript package bump

name: Inferno 1.1.0
body:
- vNode normalisation rewrite (key handling)
- added warning about duplicate keys when not in production build
- support for iOS click event delegation
- multiple bugs fixed

name: Inferno 1.0.7
body: - Hydration bug fixes and performance improvements

name: Inferno 1.0.6
body:
- Fixes an issue with hydrate text nodes
- Fixes issue where componentWillUnmount was not called for nested ES6 component
- More aggressive recycling

name: Inferno 1.0.5
body:
- Fixes an issue where bundles would duplicate content
- Improves performance in cases where recycling was enabled but not used
- Fixes an issue where `setState` might not update state correctly if called on the same nested component

name: Inferno 1.0.4
body:
- Improves to `process.env.NODE_ENV` bundling/stripping for production and development modes.
- Improved performance for `cloneVNode`.
- Various minor fixes.

name: 1.0.0-beta45
body:
Fixes issues:
- Fixes issue: Inferno stays in development mode even when minified
- Fixes issue: onChange event does not fire on controlled textArea

name: Inferno 0.7.27
body: This release contains bug fix for patchText routine.

name: Inferno 0.7.26
body:
This release contains minor changes to `inferno-dom` to better improve patching of elements props where cached prop lists are not available. `inferno-router` now has better support for NodeJS (without attempting to access browser globals). 

Various under-the-hood changes for streams in rendering were also pulled in â€“ although are still very much a work-in-progress and not for consumption until the API has been revised.

name: Inferno 0.7.25
body:
This updates contains fixes for `inferno-dom`, `inferno-router` and `inferno-server`. Specifically:
- `inferno-dom` now handles `input` elements without a `type` attribute given.
- `inferno-router` now properly handles HTML5 routing, with various additions to the `Link` component and exposure to internal router APIs.
- `inferno-server` no longer duplicated attributes from Blueprints.

name: Inferno 0.7.24
body:
This release contains minor bug fixes:
- `inferno-dom` has had recycling modifications to improve performance
- `inferno-router` should better handle context passed through
- `inferno-redux` has more test coverage and a [README.md](https://github.com/trueadm/inferno/tree/master/packages/inferno-redux)

name: Inferno 0.7.23
body:
Fixes various issues with `inferno-dom`, including:
- missing `normalise` and wrong arguments passed during the recursive `patch` operation.
- missing children from `lastProps` via sCU for stateless components.
- `mouseEvents` was missing during a patch process

Various other changes and tweaks were made. Also, `inferno-redux` is now a package supported (pending the README). You can see more about this package at: https://github.com/trueadm/inferno/tree/master/packages/inferno-redux

name: Inferno 0.7.22
body:
This release contains improves and bug fixes for `inferno-dom`. 
- Updates have been made to how Inferno patches keyed-node lists addressing issues that were reported by @localvoid.
- Unmount ing`VList`s no longer complains about DOM node not being available
- A possible infinite-loop has been removed when attempting to mount a node that would never be normalised.

name: Inferno 0.7.21
body: This release adds more test coverage and contains small bug fixes including missing import in mount.js.

name: Inferno 0.7.20
body: This aligns all packages with the same version to keep things consistent. It also fixes issues in `inferno-compat` and usage within Inferno and React mixed environments.

name: Inferno 0.7.17
body: Includes a fix for `inferno-component` where `componentDidUpdate` fired in the wrong place.

name: Inferno 0.7.16
body: This update contains bug fixes for regression issues from `0.7.15` plus a fix to `inferno-component` and how it handles `setState` whilst in `componentWillReceiveProps`.

name: Inferno 0.7.15
body:
This update contained performance improvements, a small code base and several fixes and improvements.
- `inferno-dom` now has a much leaner patch mechanism which results in better performance.
- `inferno-server` now handles stripping of potentially bad HTML characters from attributes and text nodes, which could be used for XSS attacks.
- `inferno` now properly handles JSX spread attribute events that are camelCase.
- `inferno-dom` better recycles nonKeyed elements and unmounts them with a better implementation.

name: Inferno 0.7.14
body:
This update greatly improves stability of Inferno and its packages. Highlights include:
- `inferno-server` and `inferno-dom` have much improved server-sider rendering capabilities and hydration features.
- `inferno-dom` has a completely revamped non-keyed patch implementation that is about 30% faster. It's also much easier to understand and read.
- `inferno-router` has had many bugs fixed and support for nested routes.
- `inferno-compat` has been added to add parity to users coming from React. Make sure you check the [README](https://github.com/trueadm/inferno/tree/master/packages/inferno-compat) on how to use it and give feedback where possible.
- `inferno-component` and `inferno-dom` have better component lifecycle handling, especially in cases of firing unmounting events (such as `componentWillUnmount`).
- `inferno-dom` now treats `null`, `undefined`, `false` and `true` values to a new internal `VPlaceholder` node that uses empty DOM TextNodes to track their positions as they move around the DOM tree. Furthermore, arrays within arrays and text children also adopt a similar technique using the internal object `VList` and `VText` respectfully.
- `inferno-dom` has a new API addition of `findDOMNode`, replicating the functionality of React's `findDOMNode`.

name: Inferno 0.7.13
body:
This release includes fixes for `inferno-component`, `inferno-dom` and `inferno-create-class`.
- `inferno-create-class` had an an incorrect `main` specified.
- `inferno-component` has an issue where a stack overflow might occur when sCU returned false.
- `inferno-dom` incorrectly handled `boolean` values of `true` when rendered to the DOM.

name: Inferno 0.7.12
body:
This release brings about many bug fixes to `inferno-server`, `inferno-component` and `inferno-dom`. Most notably, a new package has been added.
- New package: `inferno-create-class` allowing for ES5 creation of Inferno Components.
- `inferno-dom` now attempts to hydrate SSR content from `inferno-server`.
- `inferno-component` now properly handles sCU in some use cases where it might instead clear the content.
- `inferno-dom` now clears a container if it is no longer empty (and warns the user if they use `document.body`).
- `inferno-server` now handles Inferno's blueprints properly.
- `inferno-server` no longer attempts to access the `window` object when in NodeJS.
- `inferno-dom` unitless CSS property support has been re-added at a cost in bundle size.

name: Inferno 0.7.11
body: Includes a minor fix to `inferno-router` where `browserHistory`did not correctly provide the correct URL for a hashbang URL. The example for `inferno-router` has also been updated and a small bug fix has been made to ensure it works with the new `inferno-router` changes.

name: Inferno 0.7.10
body:
## Overview

This release fixes various issues with `inferno`, `inferno-dom` and `inferno-component`. It also introduces a new core package routing module called `inferno-router`. More can be found out about `inferno-router` at https://github.com/trueadm/inferno/tree/master/packages/inferno-router. Also, due to popular demand Inferno now supports `dangerouslySetInnerHTML` as per the React specification.

## Bug Fixes
- Components using blueprints no longer mutate static children props when a child is changed between updates
- Ref children nodes now correctly get referenced to the right parent
- Various tweaks how `context`is passed about functional components

name: Inferno 0.7.9
body:
Minor changes made:
- License changed to MIT
- Removed a rogue debug line of code from `rendering.js`

name: Inferno 0.7.8
body:
Contains various bug fixes for `inferno-dom` and `inferno-component`.
- componentWillUnmount triggering twice
- fixes attached hook not triggering when using blueprints

name: Inferno 0.7.7
body: This release contains many small bug fixes related to `inferno-component`and `inferno-dom`, including the ability to properly handle `null` renders.

name: Inferno 0.7.5
body:
All changes, bug fixes and performance tweaks are related to `inferno-dom` in this release.

## Features
- Adds support for FormElements
- Adds propert support for Boolean properties

## Bug fixes
- Fixes issue with parameter order
- Fixes component empty parameters issue
- Fixes components getting stuck in unmounted state
- Fixes children swapping position bug
- Fixes node replace does not belong to that parent node exception
- Contains new set of keyed / non keyed / mixed tests
- Fixes replace node with stateless components
- Fixes multiple issues with invalidNodes

name: Inferno 0.7.3
body:
- `inferno-dom` has a fix where a component being patched would not accept a `falsey` value from being returned properly.
- `inferno-dom` also has undocumented WIP support for `lazy` elements that can drastically improve performance in certain scenarios by taking advantage of off-screen lazy batch patching.
- `inferno-server` fixed an issue where falsey values for `0` were incorrectly handled

Also addressed issues where the bundle packages for `Inferno` and `InfernoComponent` were being incorrectly built.

name: Inferno 0.7.0
body:
Inferno 0.7 includes a vast range of performance improvements and API changes. These include:
- `Inferno.createElement` has been removed from core and is now available as a stand-alone module called `inferno-create-element`.
- `Inferno.createBlueprint` now allows you to create a blueprint of an Inferno VNode, allowing for further performance improvements and optimisations.
- `InfernoDOM` has had many issues and bug fixes applied, it should not vastly more stable than before.
- `InfernoComponent` now properly reacts to updates after the component has unmounted.
- `InfernoServer` now renders components into HTML via `InfernoServer.renderToString`.

name: Inferno 0.6.4
body: Fixes an issue in `inferno-dom` where `staticCheck` was incorrectly passed through to `diffNodes`.

name: Inferno 0.6.1
body: Fixed issues in `inferno-dom` where keyed lists wrongly get ignored when a list contains no items upon an update.

name: Inferno 0.6.0
body:
After many works of development, we're proud to say that Inferno 0.6 has been released! It's a complete re-write of much of the internals. Not only is the codebase smaller, performance has improved across the board and the amount of edge cases has dropped dramatically. 

This release is a _breaking update_, and thus, previous versions of Inferno may not be compatible with `0.6`. Specifically, Inferno no longer uses templates and the `createTemplate` API as found in `0.5`. Furthermore, Inferno `0.6` requires version `0.6` of the `babel-plugin-inferno` package if you intend to use Inferno with JSX.

Please check the `README.md` for more details on the improved API.

name: Inferno 0.5.22
body:
## `inferno`

Improves performance when creating `keys` for fragments

## `inferno-dom`

Now support Promises (experimental) on returned functions. Keyed and Non-Keyed list updates and regression fixes

name: Inferno 0.5.21
body:
Fixes some package issues and some issues with `global` in the packages.

## `inferno-dom`

Fixes an issue where a list might not render correctly when the previous item was a single child

name: Inferno 0.5.20
body:
This releases contains various build/package fixes.

## `inferno-dom`

Fixes some issues in performance and reliability of handling un-keyed node lists

## `inferno-test-utils`

Inferno now has some basic test utilities to help people write Inferno applications

## `inferno-server`

Fixed an issue that resulted in `inferno-server` from not working correctly

name: Inferno 0.5.17
body:
- Adds support for `hooks`
- Improves performance and fixes various bugs
- Adds some basic SSR (still in early development)

name: Inferno 0.5.13
body:
Inferno has now been broken into smaller, sub-packages, notably: `inferno-dom`, `inferno-component`, `inferno-server`. Please ensure you read the the `README.md` for details on the changes. Other improvements/changes listed below:
- progress made on server side rendering (still very much in early development)
- lots of bug fixes and performance improvements
- added a `dbmonster` example
- improved test coverage and test quality
- changes made to the ES linting rules
- refactors of some key components to reduce file size and improve consistency

name: Inferno 0.5.5
body:
**This release is a trial run for NPM reasons**

Inferno has now been broken into smaller, sub-packages, notably: `inferno-dom`, `inferno-component`, `inferno-server`. Please ensure you read the the `README.md` for details on the changes. Other improvements/changes listed below:
- progress made on server side rendering (still very much in early development)
- lots of bug fixes and performance improvements
- added a `dbmonster` example
- improved test coverage and test quality
- changes made to the ES linting rules
- refactors of some key components to reduce file size and improve consistency

name: Inferno 0.4.4
body:
- fixes issues with nested arrays
- fixes some issues with context and components
- further fixes linting/code ugliness
- further fixes SVG bugs
- adds greater test coverage

name: Inferno 0.4.2
body:
- fixed code someone messed up
- removed hasOwnProperty slow downs
- put code back to original state

name: Inferno 0.4.1
body:
### Changes:
- Various bug fixes
- Added full support for SVG
- fixed component issues
- more stable
- a lot more

name: Inferno 0.4.0
body: Complete re-write of Inferno, with huge new features, great test coverage and massive performance boosts.
